name: Fasolakia (Greek Green Beans)
author: Diana Moutsopoulos
summary: Fasolakia are Greek green beans stewed with olive oil and tomato, with a few pieces of potato added for good measure. This is a main dish in Greece, not a side dish, and a prime example of plant-based eating! Good crusty bread is essential for mopping up the sauce and I always need to have a healthy chunk of feta on the side. Serve fasolakia warm or at room temperature for best flavor.
ingredients: 1 ½ pounds fresh green beans, trimmed
2  yellow potatoes, peeled and cut into wedges
½ teaspoon salt, or to taste
directions: Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat and stir in onion
Cook until onion has softened, about 5 minutes
Add green beans and stir to coat in the oil
Add pureed tomato, potatoes, salt, pepper, and sugar
Stir well, then add water until beans are barely covered
Bring to a simmer, partially cover with a lid, and cook gently over medium-low heat until green beans and potatoes are soft, 25 to 30 minutes
Uncover towards the end of cooking to reduce sauce if it is too watery
